title: Experienced Recruitment Consultant (360) Job at Talenture Group
content:
Talenture Group - We specialize in Financial Services, Technology and Telecoms recruitment, delivering innovative solutions to clients. With a focus on expanding our dynamic sales team, we aim to drive growth within the commercial banking sector as a leading provider of cutting-edge workforce solution.

Why Join Us We envision a world where businesses can access the best talent globally without constraints. Our mission is to empower companies to hire the right talent anywhere in the worldand we're building the platform to make that a reality. With a proven track record and a commitment to innovation, we offer an exciting opportunity to be part of a company at the forefront of its industry.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Experienced Recruitment Consultant (360)
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking for an Experienced Recruitment Consultant to build long-term partnerships, place high-impact professionals into critical roles and deliver talent solutions with commercial precision and integrity.
	An ambitious, commercially driven Recruitment Consultants ready to thrive in a high-performance environment where standards are high, results are rewarded and careers accelerate.


Responsibilities


	This is a true 360 role and you will manage the entire recruitment lifecycle while building your own desk and market presence.
	Develop and grow client relationships through business development, networking, and referrals
	Understand hiring needs deeply and deliver tailored, commercially aligned talent solutions
	Source, assess, and engage high-caliber professionals, including senior-level candidates
	Manage a structured pipeline and consistently deliver against revenue and activity targets
	Present top talent convincingly to clients and position opportunities effectively to candidates
	Lead offer negotiations and close deals that create long-term value
	Maintain high standards of communication, feedback, and stakeholder management throughout
	You will own your desk — and your earning potential.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent)
	1–2 years of experience in recruitment, sales, or a target-driven commercial role
	A strong desire to exceed targets and maximize income
	The confidence to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels, including senior executives
	Strong business acumen and negotiation capability
	The ability to perform consistently in a fast-paced, performance-led environment
	Discipline, resilience, and a strong personal work ethic
	The confidence to work independently while contributing to team success
	The maturity to challenge constructively and think clearly under pressure
	Residence within reasonable commuting distance of Lekki, Lagos.


Why Work With Us


	We succeed with professionals who are competitive, resilient, articulate and commercially sharp.
	A high-performance environment designed to help you win
	Structured training, mentoring and ongoing development
	Exposure to senior-level and executive search assignments
	A modern office environment with a professional, energetic team culture
	Competitive base salary plus uncapped commission
	Clear reward, recognition and progression pathways for top performers
	Compensation: Competitive Base + Uncapped Commission.


Ready to Step Up?


	If you are ambitious, commercially driven and serious about building a meaningful recruitment career with a firm that values excellence, we would like to hear from you.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Officer",
  "description": "Talenture Group - Our client,&nbsp;Energi Talent Resourcing, is scaling fast and entering into a bold phase of success, and is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a commercially driven Business Development Officer to accelerate growth within our Oil &amp; Gas workforce and technical services
	This role is central to expanding revenue, deepening client penetrationand strategic expansion to position the firm beyond Nigeria into regional energy markets.
	This is not a passive sales position.
	You will influence opportunities before they formal entry into the market, shape bid strategy, lead tenders from concept to submission and position Energi Talent Resourcing as a trusted partner to operators, service companies and investors across the energy value chain.
	This is an ideal role for you if you confidently operate at the intersection of relationships, strategy and complete execution.


Responsibilities
Build Relationships &amp; Spot Opportunities Early:


	Talk to clients before tenders are even released, understand what they really need and help shape how we position ourselves
	Actively look for new business opportunities across the Oil &amp; Gas sector and not waiting for them to come to us
	Help us grow into new clients, new markets and investor-led projects.


Own the Bid Process from Start to Finish:


	Take charge of the full bid journey &mdash; from identifying the opportunity to submitting a strong, compliant proposal
	Pull together the right people, information and strategy to create proposals that stand out and win
	Work through pricing, commercial terms and potential risks to make sure our submissions are both competitive and profitable.


Work Across Teams to Deliver Strong Submissions:


	Partner closely with consultants, operations, finance, procurement and legal to ensure everything aligns
	Coordinate with suppliers, subcontractors and partners to gather technical and commercial inputs
	Once we win, make sure there&rsquo;s a smooth handover so the delivery team can execute seamlessly.


Stay Close to Industry &amp; Stakeholders:


	Follow up on bids and opportunities with NipeX, NAPIMS and other relevant bodies
	Keep track of compliance requirements and ensure certifications and registrations are always up to date
	Support conversations with potential investors, clearly presenting our value and helping negotiate commercial terms.


Track Progress &amp; Keep Improving:


	Monitor performance against growth targets and key metrics
	Lead reviews after each bid to identify what worked and what we can improve
	Keep proposal documents, client records and data organized and easy to access.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration or a related discipline
	1 - 2 years of experience in bidding, tendering, proposal management or business development
	Exposure to the Oil &amp; Gas or Energy sector strongly preferred
	Appetite to continuously learn and stay ahead of industry trends
	Strong bid management capability
	Knowledge of NipeX, NAPIMS, DPR/NUPRC and local content frameworks
	Commercial acumen and negotiation confidence
	Highly structured and performance-driven mindset.


What You Bring:


	You communicate clearly and confidently whether in writing or in meetings and know how to make a persuasive commercial case
	You understand Nigeria&rsquo;s onshore and offshore Oil &amp; Gas regulatory landscape and how it impacts business decisions
	You&rsquo;re comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders and can influence conversations at that level
	You think analytically, pay attention to detail and don&rsquo;t overlook the fine print
	You can manage deadlines and stay composed in fast-paced, high-pressure situations
	You take initiative and don&rsquo;t wait to be told what to do
	You&rsquo;re commercially minded, always looking for opportunities and thinking about growth
	You work well with others and build strong working relationships across teams
	You&rsquo;re organized, disciplined and take ownership of your results.


Why work with Us


	Competitive industry aligned salary
	Energi Talent Resourcing is built for impact
	We work alongside energy operators, service companies and investors as strategic partners, helping them solve complex talent and advisory challenges that affect performance and growth.
	That means your work here won&rsquo;t sit in the background. It will influence how we win clients, how we position in the market and how we scale beyond today&rsquo;s footprint.
	This is an opportunity to contribute to something expanding where your ideas, relationships, and execution directly shape commercial success and long-term market relevance.

Business Development Officer Job at Talenture Group




        
    

        
        Talenture Group - Our client, Energi Talent Resourcing, is scaling fast and entering into a bold phase of success, and is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a commercially driven Business Development Officer to accelerate growth within our Oil & Gas workforce and technical services
	This role is central to expanding revenue, deepening client penetrationand strategic expansion to position the firm beyond Nigeria into regional energy markets.
	This is not a passive sales position.
	You will influence opportunities before they formal entry into the market, shape bid strategy, lead tenders from concept to submission and position Energi Talent Resourcing as a trusted partner to operators, service companies and investors across the energy value chain.
	This is an ideal role for you if you confidently operate at the intersection of relationships, strategy and complete execution.


Responsibilities
Build Relationships & Spot Opportunities Early:


	Talk to clients before tenders are even released, understand what they really need and help shape how we position ourselves
	Actively look for new business opportunities across the Oil & Gas sector and not waiting for them to come to us
	Help us grow into new clients, new markets and investor-led projects.


Own the Bid Process from Start to Finish:


	Take charge of the full bid journey — from identifying the opportunity to submitting a strong, compliant proposal
	Pull together the right people, information and strategy to create proposals that stand out and win
	Work through pricing, commercial terms and potential risks to make sure our submissions are both competitive and profitable.


Work Across Teams to Deliver Strong Submissions:


	Partner closely with consultants, operations, finance, procurement and legal to ensure everything aligns
	Coordinate with suppliers, subcontractors and partners to gather technical and commercial inputs
	Once we win, make sure there’s a smooth handover so the delivery team can execute seamlessly.


Stay Close to Industry & Stakeholders:


	Follow up on bids and opportunities with NipeX, NAPIMS and other relevant bodies
	Keep track of compliance requirements and ensure certifications and registrations are always up to date
	Support conversations with potential investors, clearly presenting our value and helping negotiate commercial terms.


Track Progress & Keep Improving:


	Monitor performance against growth targets and key metrics
	Lead reviews after each bid to identify what worked and what we can improve
	Keep proposal documents, client records and data organized and easy to access.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related discipline
	1 - 2 years of experience in bidding, tendering, proposal management or business development
	Exposure to the Oil & Gas or Energy sector strongly preferred
	Appetite to continuously learn and stay ahead of industry trends
	Strong bid management capability
	Knowledge of NipeX, NAPIMS, DPR/NUPRC and local content frameworks
	Commercial acumen and negotiation confidence
	Highly structured and performance-driven mindset.


What You Bring:


	You communicate clearly and confidently whether in writing or in meetings and know how to make a persuasive commercial case
	You understand Nigeria’s onshore and offshore Oil & Gas regulatory landscape and how it impacts business decisions
	You’re comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders and can influence conversations at that level
	You think analytically, pay attention to detail and don’t overlook the fine print
	You can manage deadlines and stay composed in fast-paced, high-pressure situations
	You take initiative and don’t wait to be told what to do
	You’re commercially minded, always looking for opportunities and thinking about growth
	You work well with others and build strong working relationships across teams
	You’re organized, disciplined and take ownership of your results.


Why work with Us


	Competitive industry aligned salary
	Energi Talent Resourcing is built for impact
	We work alongside energy operators, service companies and investors as strategic partners, helping them solve complex talent and advisory challenges that affect performance and growth.
	That means your work here won’t sit in the background. It will influence how we win clients, how we position in the market and how we scale beyond today’s footprint.
	This is an opportunity to contribute to something expanding where your ideas, relationships, and execution directly shape commercial success and long-term market relevance.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Application Developer",
  "description": "The African Medical Centre of Excellence (AMCE) Abuja is a 500-bed specialty hospital offering world-class comprehensive diagnostics and treatment in oncology, cardiovascular, and haematological care, and general medical and surgical services, along with top notch research and education. The AMCE will provide exceptional care to people on the African continent, regardless of their financial means. Developed by the African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) in clinical partnership with King&rsquo;s College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust., AMCE Abuja is the first of five centres planned for development in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Application Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Applications Developer (Clinical/ERP Systems) will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining clinical and ERP applications that support AMCE operations, patient management, and enterprise resource planning.
	The role holder will develop customizations, test software, manage data migrations, train users, and resolve issues on clinical and ERP applications.
	The role holder will also be responsible for building solutions that align with AMCE&rsquo;s healthcare standards and operational needs.


Key Accountabilities / Responsibilities
Application Development and Customization:


	Develop, test, and deploy applications for clinical and ERP systems, ensuring they meet healthcare requirements and improve operational efficiencies.
	Customize applications to meet specific healthcare workflows and ERP integration needs, ensuring smooth system functionality.
	Work with selected software vendors in the implementation of AMCE systems.
	Troubleshoot, debug and optimize application performance to support AMCE professionals and administrative users.
	Provide 2nd&nbsp;line technical support to resolve user-reported issues with clinical and ERP applications.


System Analysis and Compliance:


	Work closely with clinical teams to understand needs, design applications, and enhance workflows within AMCE.
	Ensure applications adhere to healthcare regulations and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA) and meet security and privacy requirements.


Integration and Data Management:


	Design and manage integration between clinical systems, Medical equipment integration with EHR ,&nbsp; &nbsp;ERP platforms, and other healthcare applications, including EHR (Electronic Health Record) systems.
	Maintain data integrity across applications, leveraging APIs, HL7, FHIR, and other healthcare data standards for seamless information exchange.


Quality Assurance and Testing:


	Conduct rigorous quality assurance (QA) and testing to ensure application reliability, security, and usability.
	Document and address issues, incorporating user feedback to continuously improve application functionality and effectiveness


Collaboration and User Support:


	Collaborate with professionals, IT staff, and ERP stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions that improve patient care and administrative efficiency.
	Provide end-user support and training, develop user guides, and ensure applications are effectively adopted within the company.


Leadership and Effective Communication:


	Demonstrate strong communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate across diverse teams.
	Exhibit problem-solving and analytical thinking in identifying issues and developing effective and user-centered solutions.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
	Master&#39;s Degree is an added advantage
	Certification in relevant ERP platforms (e.g., SAP ERP, Oracle ERP) is preferred.
	Evidence of continuing professional and managerial development.


Experience/Skills:


	Minimum of four years of experience in application development within the healthcare industry.
	Experience with healthcare IT systems, enterprise applications like SAP, Oracle Fusion Apps/Cloud Platforms etc.
	Experience in Mobile application development.
	Solid understanding of the healthcare industry standards.
	Knowledge of project management methodologies (agile, waterfall).
	Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, C#, Python, mobile application programming languages and other web application &nbsp;languages.
	Database experience (SQL, NoSQL) and knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
	Proficiency in data integration and ETL processes for clinical systems (e.g., HL7, FHIR standards).
	Critical thinking and analytical skills.
	Demonstrable skills in written and spoken English that are adequate to enable effective communication about medical topics with patients and colleagues.
	Effective problem-solving and decision-making skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;careers@amce.net&nbsp;using Job Position and preferred Location as the subject of the email.",

Application Developer Job at African Medical Centre of Excellence Abuja(AMCE)




        
    

        
        The African Medical Centre of Excellence (AMCE) Abuja is a 500-bed specialty hospital offering world-class comprehensive diagnostics and treatment in oncology, cardiovascular, and haematological care, and general medical and surgical services, along with top notch research and education. The AMCE will provide exceptional care to people on the African continent, regardless of their financial means. Developed by the African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) in clinical partnership with King’s College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust., AMCE Abuja is the first of five centres planned for development in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Application Developer
     

            
    



Job Location: Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Applications Developer (Clinical/ERP Systems) will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining clinical and ERP applications that support AMCE operations, patient management, and enterprise resource planning.
	The role holder will develop customizations, test software, manage data migrations, train users, and resolve issues on clinical and ERP applications.
	The role holder will also be responsible for building solutions that align with AMCE’s healthcare standards and operational needs.


Key Accountabilities / Responsibilities
Application Development and Customization:


	Develop, test, and deploy applications for clinical and ERP systems, ensuring they meet healthcare requirements and improve operational efficiencies.
	Customize applications to meet specific healthcare workflows and ERP integration needs, ensuring smooth system functionality.
	Work with selected software vendors in the implementation of AMCE systems.
	Troubleshoot, debug and optimize application performance to support AMCE professionals and administrative users.
	Provide 2nd line technical support to resolve user-reported issues with clinical and ERP applications.


System Analysis and Compliance:


	Work closely with clinical teams to understand needs, design applications, and enhance workflows within AMCE.
	Ensure applications adhere to healthcare regulations and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA) and meet security and privacy requirements.


Integration and Data Management:


	Design and manage integration between clinical systems, Medical equipment integration with EHR ,   ERP platforms, and other healthcare applications, including EHR (Electronic Health Record) systems.
	Maintain data integrity across applications, leveraging APIs, HL7, FHIR, and other healthcare data standards for seamless information exchange.


Quality Assurance and Testing:


	Conduct rigorous quality assurance (QA) and testing to ensure application reliability, security, and usability.
	Document and address issues, incorporating user feedback to continuously improve application functionality and effectiveness


Collaboration and User Support:


	Collaborate with professionals, IT staff, and ERP stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions that improve patient care and administrative efficiency.
	Provide end-user support and training, develop user guides, and ensure applications are effectively adopted within the company.


Leadership and Effective Communication:


	Demonstrate strong communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate across diverse teams.
	Exhibit problem-solving and analytical thinking in identifying issues and developing effective and user-centered solutions.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
	Master's Degree is an added advantage
	Certification in relevant ERP platforms (e.g., SAP ERP, Oracle ERP) is preferred.
	Evidence of continuing professional and managerial development.


Experience/Skills:


	Minimum of four years of experience in application development within the healthcare industry.
	Experience with healthcare IT systems, enterprise applications like SAP, Oracle Fusion Apps/Cloud Platforms etc.
	Experience in Mobile application development.
	Solid understanding of the healthcare industry standards.
	Knowledge of project management methodologies (agile, waterfall).
	Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, C#, Python, mobile application programming languages and other web application  languages.
	Database experience (SQL, NoSQL) and knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
	Proficiency in data integration and ETL processes for clinical systems (e.g., HL7, FHIR standards).
	Critical thinking and analytical skills.
	Demonstrable skills in written and spoken English that are adequate to enable effective communication about medical topics with patients and colleagues.
	Effective problem-solving and decision-making skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using Job Position and preferred Location as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Chilis Restaurant is a 24-hours restaurant with good quality of food and good services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Bodija - Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time


	Transaction Handling: Process payments from customers using various payment methods such as cash, debit cards, and mobile/ transfer payments and issuing change accurately
	Order Management: Take customer orders and input them into the point of sale (POS) system accurately. Also ensure that any special requests or modifications are clearly communicated to the kitchen staff.
	Customer service: Greet customers warmly and answer any questions about the menu or promotions. Also address customer complaints or issues promptly and professionally to ensure satisfaction.
	Cash Drawer Management: Count Money in the cash drawer at the beginning and end of shifts to ensure accuracy. Maintain adequate change in the cash drawer and reconcile daily cash receipts with sales., including sanitizing
	Cleaning and Maintenance: Keep the cashier area clean and organize, including sanitizing surfaces and organizing receipts, documents and all cashiers books. Also ensure that the work area is tidy and free of clutter.
	Inventory and Supplies: Monitor supplies in the cashier area, such as receipt paper and condiments. Also notify management when stock is low and needs replenishing.
	Speed and Efficiency:Workquicklyand efficiently to minimizewait times for customers
	It&#39;s a 24hrs restaurant that runs morning, afternoon and night shifts


Requirements


	Proximity to Awolowo is preferred.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified&nbsp;candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;chilisrestaurant.ibadan@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Cashier Job at Chilis Restaurant




        
    

        
        Chilis Restaurant is a 24-hours restaurant with good quality of food and good services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Bodija - Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    




	Transaction Handling: Process payments from customers using various payment methods such as cash, debit cards, and mobile/ transfer payments and issuing change accurately
	Order Management: Take customer orders and input them into the point of sale (POS) system accurately. Also ensure that any special requests or modifications are clearly communicated to the kitchen staff.
	Customer service: Greet customers warmly and answer any questions about the menu or promotions. Also address customer complaints or issues promptly and professionally to ensure satisfaction.
	Cash Drawer Management: Count Money in the cash drawer at the beginning and end of shifts to ensure accuracy. Maintain adequate change in the cash drawer and reconcile daily cash receipts with sales., including sanitizing
	Cleaning and Maintenance: Keep the cashier area clean and organize, including sanitizing surfaces and organizing receipts, documents and all cashiers books. Also ensure that the work area is tidy and free of clutter.
	Inventory and Supplies: Monitor supplies in the cashier area, such as receipt paper and condiments. Also notify management when stock is low and needs replenishing.
	Speed and Efficiency:Workquicklyand efficiently to minimizewait times for customers
	It's a 24hrs restaurant that runs morning, afternoon and night shifts


Requirements


	Proximity to Awolowo is preferred.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Job Position: Copywriter

Job Location:&nbsp;Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Copywriter, you will be responsible for developing compelling storytelling ideas and writing scripts that drive impactful marketing campaigns.
	You will collaborate with the creative and social media teams to shape content direction and ensure consistent brand messaging across platforms.


Responsibilities


	Develop creative storytelling concepts and campaign ideas aligned with brand objectives
	Write scripts for digital campaigns, video productions, and promotional content
	Provide guidance to the social media team on script direction and content tone
	Collaborate with designers and marketers to ensure cohesive messaging across platforms


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Communications, English, Marketing, or a related field with&nbsp;1&ndash;3 years of experience in content writing, copywriting, or script development
	Strong storytelling, scriptwriting, and creative thinking skills
	Excellent writing, editing, and communication abilities.


Salary

Copywriter Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited - Our client, a reputable organization in the Digital Marketing and Creative Agency sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Copywriter

Job Location: Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Copywriter, you will be responsible for developing compelling storytelling ideas and writing scripts that drive impactful marketing campaigns.
	You will collaborate with the creative and social media teams to shape content direction and ensure consistent brand messaging across platforms.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop creative storytelling concepts and campaign ideas aligned with brand objectives
	Write scripts for digital campaigns, video productions, and promotional content
	Provide guidance to the social media team on script direction and content tone
	Collaborate with designers and marketers to ensure cohesive messaging across platforms


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, English, Marketing, or a related field with 1–3 years of experience in content writing, copywriting, or script development
	Strong storytelling, scriptwriting, and creative thinking skills
	Excellent writing, editing, and communication abilities.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / Month.    

    

        Click here to Apply
